stevengantz.memory.structure

Class MemoryGameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • stevengantz.memory.structure.MemoryGameBoard

  • public class MemoryGameBoard
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemoryGameBoard(java.util.ArrayList<MemoryCard> cardList)
      General use case constructor, pass in a list of all possible cards to be doubled into pairs internally.
      MemoryGameBoard(java.util.ArrayList<MemoryCard> completedBoard, boolean unique)
      Secondary constructor that can be used to build a game board manually Small code smell, boolean causes header to be unique and cuts down on manually code handling.

      • MemoryGameBoard

    • Method Detail

      • randomizeBoard

        public void randomizeBoard()
        Shuffle the board around using the collections interface The collections interface is not supported within GWT. Therefore, I am appropriating the code from the Collections interface. It is simply a Fisher Yates shuffle. Source: http://grepcode.com/file/repository.grepcode.com/java/root/jdk/openjdk/6- b14/java/util/Collections.java

      • checkIfBoardIsAllPairs

        public boolean checkIfBoardIsAllPairs()
        Check winning condition. Iterate through the cards on the board and check if they are all a part of a pair.
        Returns:
        whether the game is over

      • checkIfBoardHasTwoLeft

        public boolean checkIfBoardHasTwoLeft()
        Check if winning condition with wildcards. Iterate through all the cards to see if they are all pairs
        Returns:

      • getCard

        public MemoryCard getCard(int choice)
        Return the card at a certain location on the board
        Parameters:

        Returns:
